channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Around 6 Martial Arts ads on footway by 248, High St, Beckenham and opposite on the footway by Sainsbury's., 23rd July
item.description:
There is a proliferation of around 6 advertisement devices on the public footway on both sides of Beckenham High Street (Conservation Area) outside the named advertiser 'London Martial Arts Fitness" at 248, High St, Beckenham and also two large (circa 1.5m x 0.5m) freestanding weighted advertisements on the opposite side of the High St, on the public footway fronting the pedestrian alleyway to Sainsbury's. This half-dozen ads have been there at least 7 days (first seen Friday 18/7/25 and seen today Wednesday 23/7/25. No photographs as seen both tines from a moving vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 199-203, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Streetlight out, 23rd July
item.description:
One of the streetlights on our road has not been working. As a result, the street becomes extremely dark at night, which raises serious safety concerns for residents and passersby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sussex Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car appeared this week, 23rd July
item.description:
It is parked at the top of Leopold Mews (almost in Fremont street) which is a private driveway but it has no connection to any residents or visitors of residents in the mews or houses on Fremont street. We have had stolen cars left before.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fremont Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The manhole cover on Clapham High Street is rocking, 23rd July
item.description:
I am writing to report a defective manhole cover located on Clapham High Street. Each time a vehicle passes over the cover it produces a loud metallic bang akin to a gun‑shot. The noise is frequent—particularly during the night—and has become a significant disturbance; I am unable to open my windows and my sleep is severely affected. In addition to the noise nuisance, the rocking cover poses a potential danger to road users and pedestrians should the ironwork fail.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Clapham High Street, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip or bump across whole of road from kerb to kerb where the road goes over a bridge as it goes over Nathan Way /Kellener Road. It’s where there is a join in the road. Car tyres go over it with a loud thud. It’s worse when heading in the direction going towards Iron Mountain warehouse, 23rd July
item.description:
It’s been there over a year
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Avenue, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Uneven entrance going into the orchard area, 23rd July
item.description:
